paper.title: Do Country Risks Matter for Tourism Development? International Evidence
paper.abstract: This research fills the gap in the tourism literature on the impacts of country stability-including political, financial, and economic-on tourism development (i.e., international tourist arrivals, international tourism revenues, and travel and leisure sector returns). To account for possible asymmetric and nonlinear relationships among variables, we apply a new method of moment quantile regression, by using panel data from 106 countries spanning the period 2006-2017. From a global perspective, the empirical results indicate that higher country stability generally leads to higher tourism development, while there is no salient influence of financial stability on travel and leisure sector returns. This suggests that the effects of country risk ratings are mostly nonlinear across different tourism development quantiles. Additionally, different components of risk rating scores have diverse impacts on tourism development. The findings mean that policy makers should consider their tourism condition when setting country stability strategies.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究国家稳定性对旅游业发展的影响，虽然涉及金融稳定性，但其核心应用领域是旅游业而非特定的金融研究领域。
